concise_definition: v. 拒绝, 回绝, 驳回; n. 拒绝物, 废品

definitions.explanation_en: To refuse to accept, consider, or allow something; to turn down or dismiss outright, often due to unacceptability, incompatibility, or moral objection.
definitions.explanation_cn: 拒绝接受、考虑或允许某事物；因不可接受、不相容或道德上的反对而直接驳回或摒弃。
definitions.example_en: The committee rejected the proposal because it lacked sufficient evidence.
definitions.example_cn: 委员会驳回了该提案，因为它缺乏足够的证据。

definitions.explanation_en: To refuse to admit or recognize someone or something as valid, legitimate, or worthy, especially in social, professional, or emotional contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 拒绝承认某人或某事物为有效、合法或值得的，尤其在社会、职业或情感语境中。
definitions.example_en: He felt rejected by his peers after speaking out against the norm.
definitions.example_cn: 他因反对主流观点而感到被同伴们排斥。

definitions.explanation_en: An item that has been discarded because it fails to meet quality, standard, or specification requirements; a defective or substandard product.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因未能达到质量、标准或规格要求而被丢弃的物品；次品或不合格产品。
definitions.example_en: The factory produces only a few rejects per thousand units.
definitions.example_cn: 该工厂每千件产品中仅产生少数废品。

comparison.analysis: “Refuse” (拒绝) 更侧重于主观意愿上的不接受，常用于表达个人态度，语气较温和，可接不定式（refuse to do）。而 “reject” 更强调主动否定或驳回，常用于正式决定、制度性筛选或对事物价值的彻底否定，语气更强硬。
“Decline” (婉拒) 通常用于礼貌性地谢绝邀请、提议或帮助，带有尊重和委婉的色彩，常用于社交场合。而 “reject” 则更直接、更严厉，常用于否定方案、申请或产品，带有评判性。
“Dismiss” (打发走/不予考虑) 强调轻视或迅速地将某事物从考虑范围中移除，常带有不屑或不重视的意味。而 “reject” 更强调经过评估后的正式否定，常伴随理由和程序，如法庭、委员会或质检流程中的决定。
